title: third_party subdirectories missing from source releases.
body_html:
🐛 Bug

When you go to the releases page, the "Assets" downloads there are missing most of the contents of the subdirectories of the third_party directory. So for example third_party/FP16 is empty, as are most of the folders inside third_party. pytorch cannot be installed without them.

I am trying to package this for openSUSE and having specific, downloadable sources would be preferable if at all possible.

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Go to https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/releases
  2. Got to the most recent release (currently either 0.4.1 or 1.0rc1)
  3. Under "Assets", click on "Source code (zip)" or "Source code (tar.gz)".
  4. Download and open the archive.
  5. Look under pytorch_{version}/third_party.
  6. Open the folders there.

The folders are almost all empty, rendering pytorch uninstallable. For example

Could not find /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/pytorch-0.4.1/third_party/gloo/CMakeLists.txt

Expected behavior

The required third party packages are present.

body:
## 🐛 Bug

When you go to the releases page, the "Assets" downloads there are missing most of the contents of the subdirectories of the `third_party` directory.  So for example `third_party/FP16` is empty, as are most of the folders inside `third_party`.  pytorch cannot be installed without them.

I am trying to package this for openSUSE and having specific, downloadable sources would be preferable if at all possible.

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to [https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/releases](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/releases)
2. Got to the most recent release (currently either [0.4.1](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/releases/tag/v0.4.1) or [1.0rc1](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/releases/tag/v1.0rc1))
3. Under "Assets", click on "Source code (zip)" or "Source code (tar.gz)".
4. Download and open the archive.
5. Look under `pytorch_{version}/third_party`.
6. Open the folders there.

The folders are almost all empty, rendering pytorch uninstallable.  For example

```
Could not find /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/pytorch-0.4.1/third_party/gloo/CMakeLists.txt
```

## Expected behavior

The required third party packages are present.
